metadata.Title: CVE-2021-38199 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.Description:
fs/nfs/nfs4client.c in the Linux kernel before 5.13.4 has incorrectconnection-setup ordering, which allows operators of remote NFSv4 serversto cause a denial of service (hanging of mounts) by arranging for thoseservers to be unreachable during trunking detection.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-38199` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.4.0-88-generic - 5.4.0-88.99
